info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 6:04PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
At 604 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Brookville, moving east at 40 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible.
Locations impacted include... Dunlapsville, Whitewater State Park, Seven Mile, Goodwins Corner, Cedar Grove, Mounds State Recreation Area, Collinsville, Hamburg, Cottage Grove, Morning Sun, Liberty, Wheatville, Mcgonigle, Peppertown, Sharptown, Muttonville, Hamilton, Salem, Oldenburg, and Millville.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building.
Motorists should slow down and use extra caution.
When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens.
Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southeastern and east central Indiana...and southwestern and west central Ohio.
To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA...UNION COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA...WESTERN BUTLER COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO AND SOUTHERN PREBLE COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO THROUGH 645 PM EDT
